question: What should you be particularly aware of here?
Q1: Reduced road grip
Q1 explanation: YES. Snow and ice = reduced road grip.→ Reduce your speed (affects your immediate driving)
Q2: Dangerous intersection ahead
Q2 explanation: YES. The road sign warns about this.→ Reduce your speed (affects your immediate driving)
Q3: Roundabout ahead
Q4: A suitable speed here would be 60-70 km/h

question: You are driving at 20 km/h. How do you proceed?
Q1: I reduce my speed
Q2: I check for traffic behind me before I drive past the parked car
Q2 explanation: YES. You must ensure that no cars are coming from behind so you do not risk being hit.
Q3: I keep as far to the right as possible and drive past the parked car
Q4: I move slightly towards the centre of the road and maintain a good distance from the parked car

question: What damages are covered by an accident insurance?
Q1: It covers injuries and provides compensation if you yourself are injured
Q2: Damages to your own moped
Q3: Damages to other people and other people's things

question: You are driving in a busy city area. What should you be aware of before and at an intersection?
Q1: I should drive as fast as the speed limit allows, to maintain a good flow of traffic
Q2: I should drive at a reduced speed, so I have time to react to sudden situations
Q3: It can be difficult to navigate, both for me and others

question: You are driving at 50 km/h. How do you proceed?
Q1: I am particularly aware of wild animals ahead
Q2: I am particularly aware of horses and riders ahead
Q2 explanation: YES. Always be particularly aware of warning signs.The road sign warns of risk for horses and riders on the roadway.
Q3: I reduce my speed
Q4: I continue at an unchanged speed
Q3 explanation: YES. Drive at reduced speed in areas at risk of horse and rider on the roadway.

question: What rules apply if you need to carry luggage on the moped while driving?
Q1: It must not obstruct your view forward, backward, or to the sides
Q2: You must still have full control over the moped and be able to drive safely
Q3: You must be able to steer, turn, signal, and brake in a safe manner
Q4: You must not cause significant inconvenience to other road users

question: You are driving at 40 km/h. How do you proceed?
Q1: I am particularly aware of the pedestrian
Q1 explanation: YES. Particularly aware = affects your immediate driving.Hold back for pedestrians in crosswalks.→ Brake and stop (affects your immediate driving).
Q2: I continue at the same speed
Q3: I stop in front of the crosswalk
Q3 explanation: YES. Hold back for pedestrians at crosswalks.

question: You are approaching an intersection and see these traffic lights. How do you proceed?
Q1: I follow the signal for cars
Q2: I follow the signal for cyclists
Q3: I stop at the stop line before the intersection
Q4: I drive into the intersection if it can be done safely

question: What can lead to a driving ban or a conditional disqualification of your driving licence?
Q1: 3 penalty points on the licence within 3 years
Q2: 2 penalty points on the licence, within the first 3 years of having a licence
Q3: Driving over 50% faster than the speed limit in a 50 km/h zone
Q4: Driving over 60% faster than the speed limit in a 50 km/h zone

question: What is correct?
Q1: Very few moped accidents are due to the rider being under the influence of alcohol
Q2: Driving under the influence of alcohol does not affect the ability to drive safely
Q3: A third of all moped accidents are due to the rider being under the influence of alcohol

question: You have stepped out of the car. This is outside a built-up area.
Q1: I am allowed to park here
Q2: I am allowed to leave the car here for 2-3 minutes
Q2 explanation: YES. Parking is prohibited, but not stopping.

question: What can affect the vehicle's driving characteristics?
Q1: The load on the motorcycle
Q2: The tyres
Q3: The vehicle construction

question: You are driving at 50 km/h and are catching up with the vehicle in front, which is driving slowly. There is no traffic coming up behind you.How do you proceed?
Q1: I continue at the same speed
Q2: I reduce my speed
Q2 explanation: YES. You stay behind because of oncoming traffic. Adjust your speed to the vehicle in front and maintain a sufficient safety distance.
Q3: I overtake the vehicle in front immediately
Q4: I stay behind the vehicle in front for now
Q4 explanation: YES. Overtaking must be done without danger. Therefore, you should not overtake when there is oncoming traffic.

question: What is correct?
Q1: The road sign indicates that a motorway begins
Q2: The road sign indicates that an expressway begins
Q3: It is permitted to ride a moped beyond the road sign
Q4: I turn around and find another route

question: You have caught up with the cyclist ahead. There is no traffic coming up behind you. How do you proceed?
Q1: I warn with a short horn signal
Q2: I overtake the cyclist immediately
Q3: I stay behind the cyclist for now
Q3 explanation: YES. There is no room to overtake without crossing the barrier lines. Barrier lines must not be crossed. AND you should not overtake before a bend.

question: You are driving at 60 km/h and are about to merge onto the motorway. There is no traffic coming up behind you in the blind spot.How do you proceed?
Q1: I increase my speed
Q1 explanation: YES. You may drive up to 130 km/h on the motorway. The lorry may only drive up to 80 km/h, so by increasing your speed, you also increase the distance to the lorry.
Q2: I activate the left turn signal
Q2 explanation: YES. Always signal when you are entering and exiting the motorway.
Q3: I merge in front of the lorry
Q4: I reduce my speed and merge behind the lorry
Q3 explanation: YES. When merging, the vehicle in front merges first.

question: You are driving at 60 km/h. How do you proceed?
Q1: I am particularly aware of the condition of the roadway
Q2: I am particularly aware of the width of the roadway
Q3: I move to the right in the roadway

question: You are driving at 60 km/h, as is the vehicle in front of you. How do you proceed?
Q1: I am particularly aware of the condition of the roadway
Q1 explanation: YES. Particularly aware = affects your immediate driving.The sign warns of a particular danger of stone chips from the roadway. Therefore, you should keep a good distance to the vehicle in front, so it affects your immediate driving.
Q2: I continue at an unchanged speed
Q3: I increase my distance to the car in front
Q4: I drive closer to the car in front
Q3 explanation: YES. By keeping a greater distance, you minimize the risk of being hit by stone chips.

question: You are going straight ahead at the intersection. There is no traffic coming up behind you.How do you proceed?
Q1: I stop at the stop line
Q2: I enter the intersection and overtake the car in front on the right
Q2 explanation: YES. You may overtake on the right of a left-turning vehicle if it can be done safely.You have room to drive to the right of the car, and the question states that there is no traffic coming up behind you.
Q3: I enter the intersection and stop behind the car in front

question: You want to continue straight ahead on the road. There is no traffic coming up behind you.How do you proceed?
Q1: I immediately move towards the middle of the roadway
Q2: I stay on the right side of the roadway all the way up to the narrowing
Q2 explanation: YES. This way, you will not block the narrowing for any oncoming traffic.
Q3: I expect any oncoming traffic to hold back for me
Q4: If oncoming traffic approaches, I hold back
Q4 explanation: YES. The road sign indicates that you must hold back for oncoming traffic.

question: There is snow and ice on the road. How do you proceed, and what is correct?
Q1: It will be very difficult to steer and brake a moped
Q2: There will be low friction between the tyres and the surface
Q3: I should not ride a moped, as this would be irresponsible

question: You want to turn left at the intersection. How do you proceed?
Q1: I reduce my speed well before the intersection
Q2: I check in all directions before driving into the intersection
Q3: I complete the turn as one continuous left turn
Q4: I execute the turn as two independent straight-ahead manoeuvres

question: You have stepped out of the car.
Q1: I am allowed to park here
Q2: I am allowed to leave the car here for 2-3 minutes

question: You are catching up with a slow-moving tractor. There is no traffic coming up behind you.How do you proceed?
Q1: I overtake the tractor immediately
Q2: I stay behind the tractor and expect it to drive at a maximum of 40 km/h
Q2 explanation: YES. Tractors may drive at a maximum of 40 km/h.Notice the red triangle on the back of the tractor = slow-moving vehicle.
Q3: I stay behind the tractor and expect it to drive at a maximum of 50 km/h

question: What is important when you overtake?
Q1: I must ensure that overtaking can be done without danger
Q2: I must be able to abort the overtaking safely if oncoming traffic suddenly appears
Q3: I must signal with the horn before I overtake

question: Why are young, fresh drivers more frequently involved in traffic accidents?
Q1: Overestimation of their own driving abilities
Q2: Misjudgement of their own speed
Q3: Misjudgement of how sharp a turn is
Q4: Misjudgement of whether they can cross the road without disrupting other traffic

question: You have stepped out of the nearest car.
Q1: I am allowed to park here
Q2: I am allowed to leave the car here for 2-3 minutes
